exercises.title: Letter Recognition
exercises.instructions: Choose the correct pronunciation for each Georgian letter.

questions.question: What sound does the letter ა make?
questions.explanation: The letter ა represents the vowel sound [a], similar to 'a' in 'father'.

questions.question: What sound does the letter კ make?
questions.explanation: კ is an ejective consonant [kʼ], produced with a glottal closure creating a 'pop' sound. This is different from ქ [k].

questions.question: How many letters are in the Georgian Mkhedruli alphabet?
questions.explanation: The Mkhedruli alphabet consists of exactly 33 letters: 5 vowels and 28 consonants.

questions.question: Does Georgian have uppercase and lowercase letters?

options.text: No, each letter has only one form

questions.explanation: Georgian has no distinction between uppercase and lowercase letters. Each letter has a single form, which actually makes learning easier!

exercises.title: Match Letters to Sounds
exercises.instructions: Match each Georgian letter with its correct pronunciation.

questions.explanation: Practice recognizing letters and their sounds. Remember: თ is aspirated [tʰ] and კ is ejective [kʼ].

exercises.title: Vowel Identification
exercises.instructions: Identify which of these letters are vowels.

questions.question: Which of these are vowels? Select all that apply: ა, ბ, ე, გ, ი, ო, უ
questions.explanation: Georgian has 5 vowels: ა [a], ე [e], ი [i], ო [o], and უ [u]. All other letters are consonants.
